content.description: Climb the southwest corner of the Open Bible to a large slanting ledge. Move left down the ledge to climb the short dihedral with and awkward but exhilarating layback finish.
Start on the overhanging face left of North Crack. Muscle straight up the face without using either corner, or the large tree to the left of the route.
content.location: See map. Left of North Crack.

content.description:
Begin just left of the center of the face, and climb up over a slight overhang and continue to the ledge. From the ledge, climb straight up the center of the overhanging upper block past a questionable buttonhead.

 5.5 variation: Start on Popover, but finish by traversing right at the to the offwidth finish of Grisly.
content.location: See map. Starts just left of the center of the south face.

content.description: Climb 10 feet up the overhanging crack and continue up the easier blocky crack above it.
content.location: See map. Middle of Open Bible's north side.

content.description:
Start in the middle of the west face, and climb up and follow a thin seam in the back of a dihedral to the ledge. Move right almost to the corner and finish by surmounting the overhanging top block.

 Variation - Tanglefoot, 5.9: From the slanting ledge continue straight up the center of the overhanging upper face on good handholds.
content.location: Starts in the middle of the overhanging west face.

content.description: Just left of the Access Route is a nasty little overhang. This line is just like Hellish Move, but on a smaller scale. Warning: the crux is probably dealing with the face just below the roof.
content.location: See map. On the east side of Open Bible, left of the Access Route.

content.description: Start in the center of the face, directly below the offwidth crack with the tree at its base, in the upper level. Climb straight up and finish in the upper crack.
It's not as straightforward as it seems to be! Climb straight up the ridge.
content.location: See map. SE ridge of Open Bible.

content.description: Climb the east face on easy ledges just left of the large tree.

Pillar located in the same clearing as Twin Sisters and Brother Buttress. There is no walk up top access. 'Access Route' (5.0) goes up the corner with the large tree growing into the rock above a horizontal crack. There is no hardware at the top but ample features for creating anchors.
